{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3326789,"name":"ARCHER","username":"Gaspard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gaspard/{size}/209532_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T15:24:59.164Z","cooked":"

Hi, last year, I use a lot of function like WhileActiveContinous or WhenPressed to code the robot in command-based (C++) . But this year, i don’t find this method. Do you know what replaces them?

Thanks to advance,
Gaspard member of robo’lyon team

Be sure you have added the vendordep for commands (…\vendordeps\WPILibNewCommands.json), then check out this page: Binding Commands to Triggers — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation.

I vaguely recall a document on the updates, but try something like this:

  m_xbox.Back().WhileTrue(frc2::InstantCommand([&]() -> void
                                               { arm_.OpenGrip(); },
                                               {&arm_})
                              .ToPtr());

See also New for 2024 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation – these were deprecated a year or so ago, and removed for this year.

TL;DR:

WhenPressed → OnTrue
WhenReleased → OnFalse
WhileActiveContinuous → WhileTrue
ToggleWhenPressed → ToggleOnTrue
And a few others, but these are the big ones
